definitions.definition: a person who shows other people the way to a place, especially somebody employed to show tourists around interesting places

examples.text: Our **tour guide** showed us around the old town.
We hired a local guide to get us across the mountains.

definitions.definition: a person who advises you on how to live and behave

examples.text: A guru is the spiritual guide of his students.
His elder sister had been his guide, counsellor and friend.

definitions.definition: a book, magazine, app, etc. that gives you information, help or instructions about something
definitions.sensetop: guide to somethingguide to doing somethingguide for somebody/something

examples.text: Let's have a look at the TV guide and see what's on.
a Guide to Family Health
a step-by-step guide to creating your own website
study guides for mathematics and physics
an essential guide for every new parent
The book contains a quick reference guide to essential grammar at the back.
This book is the definitive guide to world cuisine.
a field guide to British birds
a survival guide for business managers
You can download a brief guide to getting started here.

definitions.definition: a book that gives information about a place for travellers or tourists

examples.text: He has written a number of **travel guides**.
I consulted my guide as I walked around the cathedral.
a guide to Italy

definitions.definition: something that gives you enough information to be able to make a decision about something or form an opinion

examples.text: **As a rough guide**, allow half a cup of rice per person.
I let my feelings be my guide.
Remember, this chart is only a guide.
As a general guide, large dogs need more exercise than small ones.
Use the table below as a guide to how much detergent to use.
As a guide, the largest pie will feed twelve.
It should only be used as an approximate guide.
These figures should be taken as a rough guide.
These figures give a rough guide as to the sales we can expect.

definitions.definition: a member of an organization (called the Guides or the Girl Scouts) that is similar to the Scouts and that trains girls in practical skills and does a lot of activities with them, for example camping

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French guide (noun), guider (verb), of Germanic origin.
